A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm really not sure where to begin with this one.

In terms of a film - it was fine. Just fine. Definitely worse than The Force Awakens.

The story lines feel pretty flat. The messages that many have labelled with the term SJW (and I understand why)\, I felt were too on the nose. I don't disagree with the inclusion of these in films but if they're going to be done in such a  ham fisted way - Just don't bother.

Too much humour\, and too silly when it was done. Prank phone calls to "General Hugs" aren't the same as Han in the dentention block. (We're all fine here\, now\, thank you. How are you?)

Luke's characterisation felt off. The way he casually tosses the light saber over his shoulder was just ridiculous\, the leaf scene with Rey. I did enjoy the scene showing how he lived on the island. Disappointed he didn't make Rey give him a piggy back ride around the island.

Captain Phasma is painfully and obviously shoe horned in at the last minute only to disappear much the same way she did in the first film.

Snoke's story abruptly cut short\, and no mention of the Knights of Ren. Kylo Ren had some good bits in this film - I might say his arc was probably the best\, along with Poe's (the execution of Poe's less so)

I left the theatre feeling a little bit empty and disappointed over all.

Positive points: Kylo is THICC AF. Damn son.
